summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury. The indictment details her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of multiple minor girls from approximately 1994 to 1997, including grooming victims and arranging travel across state lines. It also alleges she committed perjury during a 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with multiple counts related to conspiring with and facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls, including grooming victims and arranging interstate travel for sexual abuse. Also charged with perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary perpetrator of sexual abuse against minor girls, with Maxwell assisting, facilitating, and contributing to his abuse. His sexual preference for underage girls is noted.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the indictment as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to entice and transport minor girls across state lines for the purpose of sexual abuse. Maxwell assisted, facilitated, and contributed to Epstein's abuse.

Had a personal and professional relationship; were among each other's closest associates. Were in an intimate relationship from approximately 1994 to 1997, and Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his properties.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties during the time period of the conspiracy.

events.title: Conspiracy to Abuse Minors
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls, some as young as 14, at various Epstein properties.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein at his New York residence.

events.title: Massage of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell provided an unsolicited massage to Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico residence, during which Minor Victim-2 was topless.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell groomed and befriended Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and arranged interactions knowing Epstein would sexually abuse her during massages.

events.title: Perjurious Deposition Testimony (First)
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave false testimony under oath during a deposition, denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls for sexual massages and claiming she was not aware of interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Perjurious Deposition Testimony (Second)
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave false testimony under oath during a deposition, denying awareness of sex toys at Epstein's Palm Beach house, denying knowledge of Epstein having sexual activities with others, and denying ever giving anyone a massage, including Epstein or Minor Victim-2.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Residence)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for legal proceedings)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14 from approximately 1994 to 1997.
The indictment details a grooming process where Maxwell would befriend victims, normalize sexual topics and nudity, and encourage them to give massages to Epstein that led to sexual abuse.
Maxwell is accused of facilitating victims' travel across state lines (e.g., from Florida to New York) and internationally for the purpose of sexual encounters with Epstein.
Maxwell is charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016 depositions, where she denied knowledge of Epstein's activities with minors and denied giving massages.
The abuse allegedly occurred at multiple Epstein-owned properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at Maxwell's residence in London.
